script: You moved to the west side, you'd lose.
Speaking of movements, I forgot to congratulate you on Mr. Leung's promotion.
What kind of promotion is that? He's in charge of rice.
It's hard to even get someone to buy rice from India.
That's better than being in charge of the treasury.
It's good if you listen to Mrs. Yee.
Me? I'm no savior.
Mr. Ma should have listened to me.
He became in charge of transportation.
Now, he's often away and lets you run wild.
I've got my hands full.
His relatives kept coming to stay with us. My halls are crammed.
Mine.
Not only do I have to find them jobs, but I even have to feed them.
I don't even get paid for doing all that.
Right.
Let's not give Mrs. Mak the wrong impression.
She'd think the Wang government's positions are appointed by us while playing mahjong.
Isn't that so?
The Japanese would never imagine that the officials are henpecked by their wives.
Eat while the food is still hot.
I really shouldn't eat. I'm so fat already.
Everybody is hoarding these days.
All we can do is hoard fat on our bodies.
What should we hoard these days, Mrs. Yee?
You know my husband is an importer.
Pong.
Even though Hong Kong has fallen, ships must still come into port.
Mine.
Western medicine.
The last shipment sold out quickly.
Tell him to get more.
I heard you all went to Shuyu yesterday.
Yes, a bunch of us. Mrs. Mak has never been there.
Everyone laughed when I told them that.
They've already opened two branches in Hong Kong.
The chefs from Sichuan and Hong Kong can't get along. It doesn't work.
People from Hong Kong aren't used to spicy food, right?
It was really spicy yesterday, wasn't it?
Very spicy. So spicy that I… Nine of Characters.
Two of Characters.
Pong.
Mrs. Ma, you didn't go yesterday?
RED DRAGON She hasn't been here for days.
I was tied up at home.
You have a guest, so I didn't come for a couple of days.
You can't get out of treating us as promised, so you went hiding.
Who was busy when I called a few days ago?
That doesn't count.
I went to pick up Mrs. Mak. You can ask her.
Mrs. Ma deliberately chose the day I had to pick you up to treat us.
She did it on purpose.
Pong.
Did you bring more stockings?
Yes, but I gave them all away.
I'll bring more next time.
Sure.
Shanghai is short of everything these days.
Even toothpaste and soap are being sold illegally.
You should come more often.
You have a place to stay now.
He won't last much longer.
The Kenpeitai will surely take him.
They didn't say dead or alive.
Let him die a quick death.
What will you tell Mr. Miura?
They're investigating the arms the Americans provided to Chongqing.
I'll see him tonight.
His secretary called to cancel tonight's dinner.
He wants you to report to the Kenpeitai Headquarters tomorrow morning.
Won't you be returning to the office today?
I have another appointment.
Sir.
THE WORLD IS SHARED BY ALL She wanted a companion.
She bought it from Hong Kong.
She said it's my translation fee.
I was incredible.
My relative bought a diamond from a Russian.
A yellow one from an aristocrat.
The Russian aristocrats are begging on the streets.
Watch out for fakes.
I see you ladies started early today.
-Yes. -You're in luck today.
You've got Mr. Yee here rooting for you.
My turn?
Three of Characters.
Yours is nice.
How many carats is it? Three?
Is this nice?
But I think it's out of fashion.
I was planning to get it redesigned.
Pinfen came a few days ago.
She showed me a five-carat one.
It was big, but not as bright as yours.
Pong.
Why didn't you call me?
I only had time for a quick look myself.
Pong.
Pinfen has things that others don't.
She once had a premier diamond, but you wouldn't buy it for me.
Do you know how much that's worth now?
That premier diamond was over ten carats.
It's not a pigeon egg.
It's a stone after all.
With that on your finger, you couldn't play mahjong.
You wouldn't buy it and you still give me an earful.
I win.
Five sets, white dragon.
I'm one tile away.
Mr. Yee, this is your fault for saying that about diamonds.
-He's here to spoil our game. -Thank you, Mr. Yee.
This won't do. Mr. Yee better treat us to dinner.
No problem. Where would you like to go?
Shuyu.
-You eat spicy food, right? -Let's not go there.
It's expensive.
Gosh, look at me.
I'm supposed to meet someone at 3 p.m.
I completely forgot.
This won't do, how can you do this? Why didn't you say so before?
You're wicked.
I need to talk to that person.
I forgot. What should I do?
Mr. Yee, please take my place first.
I'll be right back.
My luck just improved. Goodness.
Not today. I'm busy. I'll play with you all night next time.
Mrs. Mak, you're so bad.
It's Mak's money.
After all these years, we're finally getting part of it back.
Let's invite Mrs. Liao.
Mrs. Chen! Get Mrs. Liao on the phone.
-You're buying tonight. -Right.
Mrs. Mak, Mrs. Yee said you can use her car.
It's waiting right outside.
How can I do that?
Isn't Mrs. Yee going to… All right then. Thank you.
I'll be right down.
There are so few cars here compared to Hong Kong.
Gas is expensive.
Even those who have cars don't drive anymore.
Mrs. Mak, your Shanghainese is quite good.
My mom's from Shanghai.
We moved to Hong Kong when the war started.
Is that right?
Kneel!
Kneel!
-I told you to kneel! -Kneel!
Kneel!
These foreigners are only allowed to withdraw 20 yuan a day.
So they settle for dry, hard bread.
Shall I come back for you?
Don't bother, I'll get a cab.
That's odd. Did I dial the wrong number?
Hello?
Hello? My second brother, it's me.
Yes.
I'm calling from Kiessling's Cafe.
Is everything okay at home?
Yes.
I'm doing good.
Just too busy to call home.
I'm planning to go shopping today.
I have an appointment. I'm going now.
Okay.
That's all.
All right. We're fine here.
I'll get going. Bye.
Make a move.
After you defeat the Japanese, we'll marry you!
I wasn't referring to myself.
With all the men off to war, who'll be left for us to marry?
Why do you say that? Go marry him then.
I heard the Japanese took over Guangzhou.
Do you think we'll be safer in Hong Kong?
I didn't expect us to rely on the British for protection.
Isn't your dad in England?
Why didn't he take you with him?
He took my little brother.
After my mom died, he said he'd bring me there.
But the war broke out later on.
I'll never go back home.
War gave me the chance to go to Hong Kong.
From there, I'll go overseas and see the world.
I'll meet you this evening by the pond.
Let's go home together.
Okay.
Lai Shujin!
I was hoping to run into you.
Kuang Yumin, not bad. You remember me.
I do. I saw you perform for the Women's Drama Club at Lingnan University.
We started a new drama club.
We're holding the auditions tomorrow afternoon.
But the Women's Drama Club has never acted with men.
We just borrow classrooms here at the Hong Kong University.
There are very few of us. We must work together.
Then let's perform lbsen's A Doll's House.
I know Nora's lines inside out.
In times like these, who would be in the mood for that kind of bourgeois drama?
We're planning to do a patriotic play to raise money for the resistance.
You can audition too.
But I'm only a freshman. I've never acted before.
So what?
We must all pitch in for the resistance.
Our soldiers are fighting for their lives at the frontlines while people in Hong Kong continue their leisure life.
We have to wake them up with our drums and gongs.
What a typical director. He never listens to anyone else.
But he mentioned the resistance.
Women should help too.
But when I think about letting him have his way… He seems very passionate.
His brother died from the war shortly after graduating from military school, so his parents forbade him from joining the army.
That's why he's so worked up.
I don't want him to join either.
I go back to the land that nurtured me, -my soul will soon return. -A bit to the left.
-A little bit more. -Is this okay?
Good. That's it.
-One more time. -Try it.
WITH MS. LINDA… What's the matter?
My dad remarried.
I'm writing him a congratulatory letter.
Your stage fright will be gone after we get started.
Mrs. Zhao!
They found this soldier behind the hills.
Xiaohong, is your brother home?
-Come inside. -Be careful.
-My son! -Be careful.
Go boil some water!
-Be careful. -How did you get hurt this way? Gosh!
He's a soldier, not your son!
My son is coming home tonight.
He'll be home for dinner.
Let me kill a chicken to nourish him.
My son is coming home.
He is coming home today!
My son is coming home.
My son is coming home.
Since my mom found out my brother died at the frontlines, she has been sick.
I just finished knitting this for my brother.
But he won't get to use it anymore.
Please take it.
I can't.
You saved my life and I can't repay you for it.
You've repaid me by saving the country!
You've avenged my brother by killing our enemy!
It's a shame that I am a girl.
My mom's sick, I must take care of her.
I promised my brother.
I must let him rest in peace.
Your brother… He was the same age as you.
Since my dad died, he has supported our family.
He works harder than anyone.
During harvest time, he always helped others after he was done.
He was well-built like you.
I followed him around everywhere.
He often said that heaven would protect honest folks.
He was our family's only hope!
Let me kowtow!
For our country, for my dead brother, and for our people for generations to come!
China cannot fall!
-China cannot fall! -China cannot fall!
-China cannot fall! -China cannot fall!
-China cannot fall! -China cannot fall!
-Here. Cheers! -Cheers!
We must really celebrate.
That was amazing.
Over 1,000 people were shouting, China cannot fall!
China cannot fall!
-China cannot fall! -What are you doing?
-Here he goes again. -Look at him.
Six hundred seats plus those standing in the aisles.
Don't underestimate the people in Hong Kong.
True.
Our audience at Lingnan University were never this excited.
We're telling a story about what's happening.
The audience can relate, so they were moved.
At the donation table, I saw many people still drying their eyes.
A toast to all of you.
We've finally raised some donations to contribute to the cause.
Let's drink tonight and worry about the country tomorrow.
Yumin! Cheers!
-Cheers. -Cheers.
-Cheers. -Wait.
I have an idea. Listen to me. This is what we'll do.
We should sell the tickets and put up a sign that says Limited tickets only.
But if they see you, it'll be hard to sell even one ticket.
Give me the bottle.
Be careful.
A toast to our leading lady.
We need her to sell the tickets.
-Leading lady, cheers! -Cheers!
-Here. Cheers! -Cheers!
No. I'm not.
-No. I'm not! -Cheers!

-Students in sweet youth today -Students in sweet youth today -Pillars of society tomorrow -Pillars of society tomorrow -Today, we fill this hall with songs -Today, we fill this hall with songs -Tomorrow, we make waves -Tomorrow, we make waves -To save our nation -To save our nation -Huge waves, huge waves, forever surging -Huge waves, huge waves, forever surging -Fellow students -Fellow students Come forward with all your strength Take our land's fate into our hands Huge waves, huge waves Hurry!
-Hurry! -Come on!
Come up.
-Come on. -Let's sit at the back.
Is it lit?
Artists have to smoke. Try it.
It comes in handy on stage.
-Wong Chiachi took a smoke. -Give it to me.
-Me. Give it to me. -What are you doing?
-Give it to me. -Give it to me.
Give it to me.
-Give it to me. -Give it to me.
-Let me smoke. -Let me smoke. Come on.
-That's enough. -All right.
I'm not sure.
-Hey. -Hey.
Thank you.
For what?
Wong Chiachi.
Come on up.
The other day, I ran into a guy called Cao Dexi from my hometown.
He used to hang around with my brother in school. We know each other.
I heard he's an assistant of someone in the Peace Movement.
His surname is Yee, a top agent of Wang Jingwei who's hiding in Hong Kong.
They say Wang Jingwei is involved with the Peace Movement, but he's actually a lackey of the Japanese.
He's a traitor!
Wang is recruiting men for the Japanese.
I heard that Yee is in charge of doing that in HK.
I was lucky to bump into Cao.
This is an opportunity for us.
An opportunity for what?
I'm not talking about acting in a play.
Wrenching tears from an audience and yelling until your voice is hoarse can't compare with killing a true traitor.
Summer break is coming. The school wouldn't find out.
It's better if we can disguise ourselves and infiltrate Yee's household.
I'll use my relationship with Cao, maybe he'll give us a job or something.
Then we must get some guns… But what do we know about killing people?
Our only experience is on stage.
When you are faced with a real traitor, one who betrays his own people, killing won't be hard at all.
We'll only worry about not killing enough!
You'll be risking your lives, so think about it carefully.
If we do it, we do it big!
If we die, we won't have any regrets.
Let's kill one of Wang Jingwei's lapdogs!
I'm in.
Me too.
Of course we are… I'm not forcing anyone to join.
I'm willing to join you.
-Get rich. -Get rich.
-Things will go smoothly, I got it. -Treasure, gold, money, I got it all!
I know how annoying you are.
-Drink. -Let's drink.
Yumin, I didn't expect you to come and find me.
It's so great to meet again after all these years away from home.
Enough talking. Let's drink first.
-Let's drink. -Let's drink.
Bottoms up.
A toast to Mr. Cao.
Please take care of us going forward.
Okay.
Here's to you.
Mr. Cao, see if there's an opportunity for me.
Can you find a job for me?
It's a tough job.
But all right, I'll look into it.
-Where's Lang Junsheng? -He's still up there.
What is he still doing there?
We only have enough to pay for that guy Cao.
Maybe he can get more information.
With just a few drinks?
The foreigners have left for the summer.
We can rent the second floor for a couple of months.
Where did you get the money?
My old man gave me some money in Hong Kong for me to use in case of emergencies.
Do we need such a posh place?
You want Auyang to be Mr. Mak, a businessman, and Wong Chiachi to be his rich wife.
They must live in a place like this.
Let's decorate it. Get some furniture and a maid.
Does Mr. Mak need a goatee?
Wait a moment.
Don't wipe your mouth with it. It's my best tie.
This is not a rehearsal. There are no second chances.
Remember your role before you speak.
Don't say what you're not supposed to. Less words, less mistakes.
You too.
Here they come.
Mr. Mak, Mrs. Mak.
He is Mr. Mak's cousin from my hometown, Kuang Yumin.
Okay.
This is Mr. Yee and Mrs. Yee.
Go and have fun. Please excuse me.
I'm sorry, you even came to pick me up.
Cao said that you know Hong Kong well, otherwise, we could have used my husband's car.
It's fine, it's on our way.
Mrs. Yee, you'd like to shop around Central, right?
I've been in Hong Kong for a few months and all I know is Central and Repulse Bay.
It's embarrassing.
Then let's go to Tsim Sha Tsui.
We can shop there.
Sure.
To Tsim Sha Tsui, Queen's Harbor.
Okay.
Drop us first, then go to your office.
You can be a little late, right?
We must not keep Mr. Mak from his work.
It's his family's business. It's fine.
Mr. Mak, what is your line of business?
Export trading.
As well as import.
Mrs. Yee, this is such a nice area.
We didn't see it when we were looking.
We're only renting.
When the war broke out on the Mainland, we had to move here in a hurry.
Mrs. Mak, are you a native of Hong Kong?
I came here after I got married.
My hometown is in Canton.
My mom is from Shanghai.
Then you must know the Shanghai dialect.
Yes, but not well.
I've forgotten most of it.
I was originally from Anhui province.
My Shanghainese is so-so too.
Thank you.
I'm sorry to make you carry my things.
It's nothing. My pleasure.
He's our cousin. It's fine.
He's also new in Hong Kong.
We brought him along for sightseeing.
What did you do in Canton?
I was a teacher in an elementary school in the suburbs.
No wonder.
I thought you looked educated and were either a college student or a teacher.
Yes. Mrs. Yee, you're so observant!
Didn't you see all his plainclothes security by the gate?
There's no way to kill him at his home.
When he goes out, he has a driver and at least one guard with him.
Even if we lure him out, we have to deal with three people.
We'll need at least two guns.
That's still better than trying it at his home.
We must be patient. We've made contact already.
Mrs. Yee has a good impression of Wong Chiachi.
They've already agreed to meet again.
Excuse me. I'm tired.
-Can I come in? -Nice.
-Come in. -Move a bit.
-Come and see. -I haven't seen it before.
I rushed the tailor.
Thanks.
This Yee guy, what does he look like?
I only caught a glimpse. He's not what I imagined.
The cook just disappeared on us.
He didn't steal anything. He just disappeared.
That's why we moved to the Peninsula. It has been five days.
We don't dare to go back.
My husband said it's not safe and we need to find another home.
You can't trust any of them here.
These Cantonese people, I don't understand a word they say.
Right. I'm worried.
Where can I find a chef who can cook decent Shanghai dishes?
I know a restaurant in Hong Kong with great Shanghai cuisine.
The scallion carp and drunken chicken are good.
You must take us there.
Yee, Mrs. Mak was just telling us about a great Shanghai restaurant here.
He's the real picky one.
Not even the best restaurant can satisfy him.
Really? Which one?
Zhujia Restaurant. It's in Kowloon.
It's owned by the main chef from Tang's in Shanghai.
I think I've heard of it.
I will be out late tonight.
Don't forget, we're entertaining guests tomorrow.
Good night.
You're entertaining people? Why aren't we invited?
He won't even tell me who it is.
It must be Wang Jingwei's wife, Chen Bijun.
They want to set up a new government.
My husband has also been approached.
That means Mr. Yee is going to be promoted.
I told you!
Why are you so late?
We played mahjong.
I'm sorry, I lost again.
Was Yee there?
For a minute.
But he left and never came back.
-Shujin. -Hey.
Get off. I'm exhausted.
I hit a bottle.
You're good.
It's been a month and you're excited about hitting one or two bottles.
Why don't you just kill me and save my old man the trouble!
The apartment, car, mahjong, shopping, buying high-class products, and even your whores!
Are we killing traitors or having a vacation?
How many dads do I have?
Wong Chiachi needs fancy jewelry and you play the resistance hero.
What about me?
I drive during the day and even stand guard at night!
My dad's investigating me, thinking I've been involved with a whore!
He wants to disown me!
You guys figure it out yourselves!
We've got guns.
Why don't we shoot a couple of easy targets?
Otherwise, school is about to start.
We all joined freely.
Why are you blaming Kuang Yumin?
I'm aware of the issue with money.
I should have foreseen the consequences.
I admit we're amateurs.
But we made a decision and finally got access to Yee's household.
Should we give up now?
I know the guards now.
I'll find a chance to make a move and face the consequences.
Don't be stupid.
How can you get to Yee by yourself?
That's my business.
That's enough.
The papers are in the study.
Mr. Yee.
Mrs. Mak.
My car broke down halfway and it rained.
Take Mrs. Mak inside.
Hong Kong is so humid.
You can squeeze out water just by making a fist.
Right, Shanghai isn't this way.
After all these years, I'm still not used to it here.
Hey, Mrs. Hsiao.
I thought you wouldn't come because of the typhoon.
Why are you back?
My appointment was canceled due to the rain.
Mrs. Mak, Mrs. Chu, you're here.
We were waiting for Mrs. Hsiao.
You are just in time. We need another player.
I have things to do.
Come on, Yee. Just until Hsiao comes.
When was the last time you played?
Mr. Yee, Mrs. Yee is getting mad.
All right.
Seven of Characters.
Mine. East wind.
Yee actually likes the fabric we got the other day.
But he's not happy with our tailor.
Do you know anyone good?
Yes, there's one. He has good skills.
He does all our cheongsam and suits.
-South wind. -Pong.
Should we try him?
You decide.
Seven of Dots.
-Mine. -Pong.
But it's peak season now.
They're busy with the tourists.
It's not going to take months, is it?
No. I'm an old customer.
I can tell them to rush yours first.
Seven of Dots.
Mine. Nine of Dots.
This is what we'll do.
When Mr. Yee is free, give me a call, Mrs. Yee.
Mrs. Mak. I have your number.
Eight of Dots.
Pong.
Four of Bamboos.
In the upcoming sale, we can take a look at other fabrics.
Mr. Yee likes British imports.
Those never go on sale.
Is that so?
Six of Characters.
Does this mean I won?
You're lucky today.
I almost didn't know I won.
The god of fortune is with me today.
Five, six, seven, eight.
Charge.
Charge. Spin.
Giddy up.
Spin. Your leg.
Okay, again.
Slow, quick, quick.
Please wait.
Mr. Yee.
I recognized your voice.
The collar can be a little more snug. It'd suit his face more.
Yes. It looks much better with a narrow collar.
Shorten the sleeves a bit.
With shorter sleeves, it would make you look sharper.
You decide.
It's the latest look.
The collar is nice.
Ma'am, we've made the alterations for your cheongsam. This way, please.
Let me try it on.
Go eat. Don't wait for me.
Okay.
Does Mrs. Mak often let you make her clothes?
Yes.
She has helped me out quite a bit.
It fits too well now. I can hardly breathe.
Your wife picked this fabric first, but she thought it was a bit gaudy, so I took it for myself.
Well, this is fine. Let me take it off.
Leave it on.
All right.
I hope Mrs. Yee is fine.
Cao has taken her to the doctor.
She complained of a headache when we were about to leave.
All that mahjong, I guess.
My husband doesn't like me playing either. We always argue about it.
I told him men have endless distractions.
What about us? We only have shopping and mahjong.
Mahjong should be okay. We just stay indoors.
When I called you today, was I interrupting anything?
My husband is away in Singapore, so his friends came over to keep me company.
Actually, they're keeping an eye on me.
Your call gave me the perfect excuse to leave.
Is that so?
Sometimes, I'd rather go out on my own when I'm free.
The things I like don't interest Mak.
What do you like?
Going to the movies.
Mak won't go with me, so I usually go by myself.
He and his friends only talk business.
Nobody likes movies.
I don't watch movies either.
Mr. Yee, you are too busy.
Movies are for people with time to kill.
It's not that. I don't like dark places.
Would you like a drink?
I'll drink a little with you.
We know very few people in Hong Kong, so we're always troubling you.
Don't mention it. It's not a big deal.
But if you pay attention, nothing is trivial.
There doesn't seem to be a lot of customers here.
Because the food is so bad.
My apologies. But it is a perfect place to talk.
No one will disturb you.
Your husband works a great deal?
I have no idea what he's busy with.
He's away in Singapore again, but… Having a man is fine as long as he is away from home, right?
And what kind of business is he in?
Import-export.
If you're so interested in Mak, I'll bring him along next time.
You men have so much to say to each other, but with women, you just make small talk.
To me, small talk like this is a rare treat.
I deal with prominent people who always talk about important state matters and the fate of our nation.
But I don't care about what they say.
I see only one thing in their eyes.
What is it?
Fear.
But you… You seem different.
You're not afraid, are you?
What about you?
You're smart, but you're not good at mahjong.
You're right. I always lose.
I just won against you.
Should l pick up your suit when it's ready?
I'll call you.
I have another appointment tonight.
I still have some time. Allow me to drop you off first.
Would that be inconvenient for you?
No.
They're back!
-Turn off the lights! -Watch them!
-Thank you. -I'll see you to the door.
You really shouldn't bother.
Wait here.
They're back!
Lights off!
They're coming inside!
Fine with me.
Just don't blame me if you're late for your appointment.
You have an appointment.
Otherwise, you could send the car away and come in for a cup of tea.
I need a drink.
He's so cautious.
He sent Cao and his bodyguard away while we were at the tailor's.
It's obvious that he doesn't even trust Cao.
Simple.
Next time, get him in here and we'll finish him off with one shot!
He'd never come inside because of Mak.
He would only take me someplace secluded.
Cao probably doesn't even know the place.
Did he try anything?
Mr. Mak is jealous.
Not yet. But I knew what was on his mind.
Otherwise, he wouldn't have seen me to the door.
He just didn't dare to come in, but he kept me at the door for a long time.
He said he'd call again.
I wanted to lure him into a theater, where it's easier to get away afterwards.
But he's so cautious.
He said he doesn't go into dark places.
If he calls again, then it's serious.
That means I'm agreeing to be his mistress.
And then have you thought about what we're going to do next?
Would you know what to do?
With a man?
So you've already discussed it.
Which one?
Lang Junsheng is the only one experienced.
With whores?
Want a drink?
No need.
The lights.
You seem to be having a reaction today.
I don't want to talk about it.
Wong Chiachi.
Time to eat.
I'm not hungry.
We made some congee.
-Hello? -Is this Mrs. Mak?
Mrs. Yee, hi.
Hi.
I called a couple of days ago, but you were out.
What's the matter?
I wanted to see if the tailor was done.
You don't want them anymore? Why?
You're moving back to Shanghai?
Congratulations to both of you.
I'll come by right now.
I haven't heard from you for a few days.
I should pay you a visit.
I'll go to the airport tomorrow.
I should… I should at least treat you to dinner.
You're leaving just like that?
I… All right.
Please give my regards to Mr. Yee.
Have a safe trip.
Bye.
You're moving?
